text: you
yes it's angel today I am super excited
to share with you one of my favorite
Taiwanese breakfast which is homemade
soya now when I go back to Taiwan I
always like to have soya milk for
breakfast and there are a lot of street
vendors out there that sell homemade
soya and it's served with things like
Chinese donut which is also very
delicious and you can usually order it
sweet or salty now I love the sweet
version so today I'm going to show you
how to make sweet soy milk which is also
known in Manion as gentle gem so with
that let's get started on the
ingredients for this recipe we'll need
three simple ingredients I'm starting
with 1 cup of organic soybeans try to
look for the organic kind of you can
because I notice that the organic
soybeans look a little bit better than
the regular ones we'll also need 4 cups
of filtered water and about 3
tablespoons of organic cane sugar now
feel free to use more or less to your
liking
next start by washing and soaking your
soybeans overnight and I really
recommend doing this for at least 10 to
12 hours longer is totally ok too
you just want to make sure that they're
soft enough so that we can blend now
I've gone ahead
soak this overnight so these ones are
soft using your hands wrap the soybeans
together between your fingers this will
help remove the skins of the soybeans
and you want to do that as much as
possible don't worry about getting them
all off just as much as possible is
great now as you do this you'll notice
that the skins start floating to the top
of the water just go ahead and skim them
off and discard them finally when you're
done scar the water and give it one last
rinse now that we have our soybeans
prepared go ahead and put all of them
into the blender
and three cups of water note bag
reserving one cup for later then go
ahead and blend until it's completely
blended
okay that looks pretty well blended
there so what we're going to do now is
get a cheese cloth lined large bowl and
we're going to pour this into the bowl
and basically strain out the soy milk
now you can also use in that bag if you
have one of those but I'm going to go
ahead and use a cheesecloth because
that's what I have handy today now
here's where we save the other cup of
water I'm just going to pour that in
there as a way to kind of rinse
everything inside this make sure we get
all that nice swing milk in here now
comes the fun part make sure your hands
are clean and we're going to go ahead
and just get in there and squeeze out
all the swing-up
kind of
okay that looks pretty good so when
you're done you can either discard these
grounds or use them as compost for your
garden or you can even use this to make
a vegetarian dish next transfer your soy
milk to a pot and cook over medium low
heat until it boils
make sure to constantly stir and scrape
the bottom of the pan so the milk
doesn't burn as you go skim off any foam
off the top with a spoon finally add and
mix in your cane sugar until it's
completely dissolved then let it simmer
and cook for three to five minutes
once you're done transfer the soy milk
to a bowl and serve it hot with the
spoon
so this is how you make a sweet homemade
soymilk which I personally like eating
with Chinese Dona I made some Chinese
doughnut earlier and if you guys want to
see me make this do give me a thumbs up
and post in the comments below letting
me know that you want to see a Chinese
doughnut recipe but I like eating my
Chinese doughnut and soy milk by first
sipping the Chinese doughnut into the
soy milk then taking a bite hmmm
it's really good I love the saltiness of
the Chinese doughnut and the sweetness
of the soy milk I'm just going to have
another sip here I hope you guys liked
this video and as an added bonus I will
dedicate my next video to those of you
who would ask me to please make a sweet
Asian tofu dessert some of you in social
media have reached out and asked me how
to make that so I will dedicate that
